label: MACHINE GUN COMPANY LEADS TO PROMOTIONS

resource.chars:
MACHINE GUN COMPANY
LEADS TO PROMOTIONS

News comes from the military
department that a machine gun
company is in the process of or-
ganization. Seven first lieutenants
have been made happy with the an-
nouncement that they are now’ cap-
tains.
The new captains are Alfred H.
Clark, Commander Machine Gun
Company; ■ Edward S. Thompson,
second in command, Machine Gun
Company; William E. Bishop, sec-
ond in command, Company B.; Ice-
land H. Cheek, second in command,
Company A,; Madison McCauley,
second in command, Company C.;
B. Ellesmere McKeige, Battalion
Adjutant; William Trimble, Bat-
talion Supply Officer.
The following have been raised
Irom second lieutenants to first:
Lionel K. Ensor, Company B;
George Melchoir, Company A.;
Lionel E. Newcomer, Machine Gun
Company: Lawrence E. Lehman,
Company A.; William H. White-
ford, Company C.; and Theodore
Johnson, Company B.
J. B. Seth is to remain Lieut.
Col., M. Stewart Whaley, major,
and Captains Eric Metzeroth. Rus-
sel Allen, and George O’Neill are to
continue in command of rifle com-
panies A., 8., and C., respectively,
while Captain Edward Barron wTH
still handle the band.
Five juniors are transferred from
rifle companies to the machine gun
company. They are Sergeants Leroy
W. Sheriff, M. O. Wooster, W. G.
Bewley, C. L. Propst, and E. B.
Rothgeb.
U. of M.
